response.overview: Punto Muerto is a Spanish short film about a young painter whose dream of artistic recognition unravels into surreal visions and emotional crisis after rejection. Directed by Goya nominee Miguel Ángel Sánchez and produced by Goya Award winner Andrés Sáenz de Heredia, the film stars Martxelo Rubio (27 Horas) and Luisi Solaguren (Historias del Kronen). Officially selected at the Seminci and L'Alfàs del Pi Film Festivals, it reflects on rejection, isolation, and psychological descent.
response.title: Deadlock
